content.text:
# List of pro-Palestinian protests in the United Kingdom

This is a list of pro-Palestinian protests in the United Kingdom including demonstrations, marches, sit-ins, direct actions, and campus encampments in support of Palestinian rights.
List
Estimated attendance is either mentioned explicitly in the references or a midpoint is used, i.e., 50 when dozens are mentioned, 500 when hundreds are mentioned, and so on.
Pre-2023

|

|10,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center. Protesters also showed support for the victims of the Israeli attacks amid the 2006 Lebanon War.

|
|6,000-50,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center. Protesters threw thousands of shoes symbolizing anger against the latest wave of bombing by Israel on Gaza.

|-
|2 September 2011
|
|?
|Disruption of a concert by the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra at the Royal Albert Hall.
|
|-
|12 April 2012
|
|300
|Demonstration outside the Israeli embassy. A group of 500 pro-Israel demonstrators was also present. Clashes occurred between the groups. Ended with police intervention. Several protesters were injured. Six pro-Palestine protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|26 July 2014
|
|45,000-100,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|

|9 August 2014
|
|20,000-150,000

|

|
|150
|Blocking of traffic at Oxford Circus.

|-

|3,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center in protest of the centenary of the Balfour Declaration.
|
|-
|8 December 2017
|
|?
|Demonstration outside the U.S. embassy against Donald Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. Bella Hadid joined the protests.
|
|-
|30 March 2019
|
|500
|Demonstration outside the Israeli embassy.
|
|-
|30 March 2019
|
|5,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|11 May 2019
|
|5,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|6 September 2020
|
|50
|Demonstration outside the headquarters of Elbit Systems to highlight its role in supplying 85% of the drones used by the Israeli army and demanding its immediate closure.
|
|-
|1 February 2021
|
|?
|Blocking of the entrance of the Elbit Ferranti factory. Activists from Palestine Action and Extinction Rebellion protesters chained the gates, unfurled banners, and sprayed red paint.
|
|-
|13 April 2021
|
|2
|Occupation on top of the roof of the Bristol headquarters of Elbit Systems. The activists from Palestine Action climbed to the roof, unfurled Palestinian flags, and sprayed red paint over the building. The occupation lasted for several hours.
|
|-
|9 May 2021
|
|?
|Demonstration in the city center organized by Muslim Association of Britain amid the 2021 Israel–Palestine crisis.
|
|-
|9 May 2021
|
|?
|Demonstration in the city center organized by Muslim Association of Britain amid the 2021 Israel–Palestine crisis.
|
|-
|9 May 2021
|
|?
|Demonstration in the city center organized by Muslim Association of Britain amid the 2021 Israel–Palestine crisis.
|
|-
|9 May 2021
|
|?
|Demonstration in the city center organized by Muslim Association of Britain amid the 2021 Israel–Palestine crisis.
|
|-
|14 May 2021
|
|?
|Disruption of traffic at the Queensway tunnel.
|
|-
|15 May 2021
|
|150,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center in response to the escalation of attacks by the Israeli army amid the 2021 Israel–Palestine crisis. Thirteen protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|19 May 2021
|
|4
|Occupation of an Elbit Systems-owned unmanned aerial vehicle (drone) factory in Meridian Business Park. Palestine Action activists climbed to the roof of the factory. Lasted until 25 May. Ten protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|21 May 2021
|
|500
|Demonstration outside Meridian Business Park Elbit factory in support of the ongoing occupation.
|
|-
|22 May 2021
| Nottingham
|?
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|22 May 2021
|
|?
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|22 May 2021
|
|?
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|22 May 2021
|
|180,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|29 May 2021
|
|500
|Climbing on to a BBC building in MediaCityUK. The protesters chanted "BBC shame on you" and criticized BBC for its "biased" coverage of the situation.
|
|-
|29 May 2021
|
|1,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center. Three protesters burned Israeli flags.
|
|-
|12 June 2021
|
|5,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center to demand the stopping of arms sales with Israel. Protesters gathered at Downing Street to call for G7 leaders to end their support for Israel ahead of the G7 summit.
|
|-
|26 June 2021
|
|5,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.

|
|10,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|17 February 2024
|
|200,000-250,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center. Twelve protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|20 February 2024
|
|500
|Occupation of the media building of the Goldsmiths, University of London. Lasted at least until 25 February.
|
|-
|7 March 2024
|
|?
|Occupation of the Parkinson Building of the University of Leeds.
|

|8 March 2024

|Occupation of the Victoria Rooms of the University of Bristol.

|8 March 2024
|
|?
|Occupation of the Professor Stuart Hall building of the Goldsmiths, University of London as an escalation of the action started on the 20 February.

|
|400,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|

|19 March 2024
|
|?
|Occupation of the Wills Memorial Building of the University of Bristol.
|
|-
|25 March 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the campus of the University College London. Lasted at least until 26 April.
|
|-
|22 April 2024
|
|?
|Demonstration at the University of Leicester.
|
|-
|22 April 2024
|
|?
|Demonstration outside the Elbit Systems UK drone factory.
|
|-
|26 April 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the campus piazza of the University of Warwick. The encampment was later moved to outside Warwick's Senate House. Lasted until 26 June. Ended by protesters disbanding on their own.
|
|-
|1 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the University of Manchester. Lasted until 17 June. Ended by protesters disbanding on their own.
|
|-
|1 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the University of Leeds. Lasted until 19 June. Ended by protesters disbanding on their own under threat of legal action.
|
|-
|1 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the University of Sheffield and the Sheffield Hallam University. Lasted until 23 September. Ended by protesters being evicted and relocated to a nearby park.
|
|-
|1 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the University College. Protesters also occupied the library at Goldsmiths. On 3 May, Goldsmiths agreed to the protester's demands, naming a building after Palestinian journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, review the University's policy regarding the IHRA working definition of antisemitism, and to erect an installation on campus memorializing the protest.
|
|-
|1 May 2024
|
|40-200
|Encampment at the Newcastle University. Lasted at least until 24 June.
|
|-
|6 May 2024
| Old Aberdeen
|?
|Encampment at the King's College campus of the University of Aberdeen.
|
|-
|6 May 2024
|
|200
|Encampment at the lawn of the Oxford University Museum of Natural History of the Oxford University. Lasted until 25 June. Ended by protesters disbanding on their own.
|
|-
|7 May 2024
|
|?
|Sit-in at Queen's University Belfast. Among other demands, protesters called for Hillary Clinton to be removed as the university's chancellor.
|
|-
|8 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at Abercromby Square at the University of Liverpool  and unofficially renamed after the murdered Gazan poet Refaat Alareer.
|
|-
|8 May 2024
| Bangor
|?
|Encampment at Bangor University.
|
|-
|9 May 2024
|
|10-15
|Encampment at Alexandra Square of the Lancaster University.
|
|-
|10 May 2024
|
|15-20
|Encampment at Durham University. Lasted until 21 June. Ended by protesters disbanding on their own.
|
|-
|10 May 2024
| Nottingham
|40
|Encampment outside the Advanced Manufacturing building on Jubilee Campus of the University of Nottingham.
|
|-
|13 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at Queen Mary University of London.
|
|-
|13 May 2024
|
|50
|Encampment at the Library Square of the University of Sussex.
|
|-
|14 May 2024
| Cardiff
|?
|Encampment at Cardiff University.
|
|-
|14 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment in front of the Lincoln Arts Centre of the University of Lincoln.
|
|-
|14 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the Penryn Campus of the University of Exeter and Falmouth University.
|
|-
|14 May 2024
| Exeter
|?
|Encampment at the Streatham campus of the University of Exeter.
|
|-
|14 May 2024
|
|500
|Encampment at the Marshall Hall of the London School of Economics. Lasted until 17 June following a court order for eviction.
|
|-
|15 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at the University of York.
|
|-
|15 May 2024
| Cambridge
|100
|Demonstration outside of Trinity College, Cambridge to protest against the college's alleged complicity in the Gaza war, holding up signs like "Trinity College funds genocide" and "Gaza has been held hostage for 107 years".
|
|-
|18 May 2024
|
|?
|Demonstration and march through the city center on the occasion of the 76th anniversary of the Nakba.
|
|-
|18 May 2024
|
|50
|Die-in and disruption of a graduation ceremony at the Sheldonian Theatre.
|
|-
|19 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment outside the Radcliffe Camera on Radcliffe Square. The Bodleian Library responded by limiting access via the Gladstone Link. Lasted until 8 July.  Ended by protesters disbanding on their own under threat of legal action.
|
|-
|20 May 2024
| Reading
|?
|Encampment at the University of Reading.
|
|-
|23 May 2024
|
|?
|Demonstration at Oxford University. Protesters occupied the office building of Vice-Chancellor Irene Tracey, overlooking Wellington Square, hanging a Palestinian flag and list of demands out of an office window. Ended with police intervention. 17 protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|23 May 2024
|
|100
|Demonstration in support of the protesters arrested at Oxford University. Ended with police intervention. Some protesters were injured, including a student suffering a concussion and an elderly lady being knocked over.
|
|-
|27 May 2024
|
|?
|Encampment at Imperial College London. Lasted until 20 June. Ended by protesters disbanding on their own.
|
|-
|27 May 2024
|
|?
|Occupation inside the Whitworth Hall of the University of Manchester, disrupting exams that were due to take place in the building.
|
|-
|27 May 2024
|
|20
|Sit-in at library of the Aberystwyth University. Lasted until 3 June.
|
|-
|6 August 2024
|
|6
|Breaking into headquarters of Elbit Systems by Palestine Action activists, damaging equipment and spraying red paint on materials. Ended with police intervention. Two police officers were injured. Six protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|21 September 2024
|
|500
|Demonstration and march through the city center. Protesters carried a 500-meter-long red banner symbolizing the red line that Israel had crossed.
|
|-
|5 October 2024
|
|5,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center. Ended with police intervention. Fifteen protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|14 November 2024
|
|100
|Demonstration outside Ulster University's Belfast campus during a visit of Prince William.
|
|-
|14 November 2024
|
|200
|Demonstration outside Queen's University Belfast during a visit of Hillary Clinton. Ended with police intervention. Four protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|30 November 2024
|
| 125,000
| Demonstration and march through the city center, starting from Park Lane carrying Palestinian and Lebanese flags with signs condemning Benjamin Netanyahu and calling for his arrest.
|
|}

|18 January 2025
|
|100,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center. 77 protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|24 January 2025
|
|100-150
|Occupation of the Radcliffe Camera of the Oxford University. Ended with police intervention. 13 protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|15 February 2025
|
|150,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center against Donald Trump's February 2025 proposal for the Gaza Strip.
|
|-
|15 March 2025
|
|55,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center.
|
|-
|5 April 2025
|
|40
|Blocking of car traffic near King's Cross station. Ended with police intervention.
|
|-
|6 April 2025
|
|50
|Human chain at the corner of Oxford Street and Wonderland Road.
|
|-
|12 April 2025
|
|300
|Demonstration outside weapons manufacturer Teledyne Technologies.
|
|-
|17 May 2025
|
|600,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center on the occasion of the 77th anniversary of the Nakba and calling for the government to 'take action' to stop the atrocities against Palestinians.
|
|-
|29 May 2025
|
|?
|Vigil at Elizabeth Tower outside of the Palace of Westminster  where activists including Steve Coogan, Toby Jones, and Juliet Stevenson read out the names of more than 16,000 children that were killed in Gaza. Lasted more than 18 hours.
|
|-
|4 June 2025
|
|5,000
|March outside of the Parliament of the United Kingdom while wearing red to create a "Red Line for Palestine", demanded that the government impose an arms embargo and sanctions against Israel.
|
|-
|20 June 2025
|
|5
|Defacing of two Voyager aircraft with crowbars and repurposing of a fire extinguisher to spray red paint to the planes and the runway of the Brize Norton Royal Air Force base. Five activists from Palestine Action were later arrested in connection to this direct action.
|
|-
|9 August 2025
|
|500
|Demonstration at the Parliament Square to protest against the ongoing genocide in Gaza and in opposition to the banning of Palestine Action. Ended with police intervention. 446 protesters were arrested.
|
|-
| 6 September 2025
|
| 1,500
| Demonstrators clashed with police outside of the Parliament of the United Kingdom to protest against the ban of Palestine Action group. 890 people were arrested.
|
|-
|23 September 2025
|
|6
|Demonstration outside drone factory of UAV Tactical Systems whose majority shareholder is Elbit Systems. Ended with police intervention. Six protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|4 October 2025
|
|1,000
|Demonstration at the Trafalgar Square in support of Palestine Action. Ended with police intervention. 488 protesters were arrested, the oldest being 89 years old.
|
|-
|7 October 2025
|
|?
|Demonstration inside the Belfast City Hall.
|
|-
|7 October 2025
|
|500
|Walkout by students of the King's College London, the London School of Economics, University College London and School of Oriental and African Studies.
|
|-
|11 October 2025
|
|50,000
|Demonstration and march through the city center. Protesters shouted "Free Palestine" and "Death, death to the IDF". A small group of pro-Israeli counter-demonstrators infiltrated the march. Ended with police intervention. 14 protesters were arrested.
|
|-
|21 October 2025
|
|14
|Demonstration outside drone factory of UAV Tactical Systems. Ended with police intervention.
|
|-
|6 November 2025
|
|500
|Demonstration outside Villa Park against Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.. Ended with police intervention. Eleven protesters were arrested.
|
|}
